content: Source "http://www.adn.com/news/politics/fbi/stevens/story/743906.html" quote: The Justice Department moved to dismiss former Sen. Ted Stevens' indictment on Wednesday, effectively voiding his Oct. 27 conviction on seven counts of filing false statements on his Senate financial disclosure forms.
quote: The Justice Department moved to dismiss former Sen. Ted Stevens' indictment on Wednesday, effectively voiding his Oct. 27 conviction on seven counts of filing false statements on his Senate financial disclosure forms.
title: All charges dropped against Ted Stevens

content: Easy, by not giving the defense during discovery, potentionalily exculpatory evidence. In this case, pretty strong evidence.

content: quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: Easy, by not giving the defense during discovery, potentionalily exculpatory evidence. In this case, pretty strong evidence. Actually I was questioning whether or not it was really an oversight. The laws have been on the books since the 1960s. Any US Attorney would have known they were required to inform the defense of the evidence.
